A
object indicates a location along a route. It may be the route’s origin or destination, or it may be
another location that the route visits. A waypoint object indicates the location’s geographic location along with
other optional information, such as a name or the user’s direction approaching the waypoint.

per segment per step per leg.
A
object defines a single leg of a route between two waypoints. If the overall route has only two
waypoints, it has a single
object that covers the entire route. The route leg object includes
information about the leg, such as its name, distance, and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to
calculate the route, the route leg object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.
A
object specifies turn-by-turn-optimized criteria for results returned by the Mapbox Map
Matching API.

Wraps a route object used across the Navigation SDK.
A
object represents a single distinct maneuver along a route and the approach to the next maneuver.
The route step object corresponds to a single instruction the user must follow to complete a portion of the route.
For example, a step might require the user to turn then follow a road.
A
object specifies turn-by-turn-optimized criteria for results returned by the Mapbox
Directions API.
